article.description: FGCU wins 10th straight with 86-72 victory over USC Upstate
article.headline: FGCU wins 10th straight with 86-72 victory over USC Upstate
article.linkText: FGCU wins 10th straight with 86-72 victory over USC Upstate
article.story: FORT MYERS, Fla. -- Brett Comer had 22 points and nine assists on Saturday and Florida Gulf Coast won its 10th straight, rolling past South Carolina Upstate 86-72. Bernard Thompson scored 19 points, including 5-of-5 shooting from 3-point range. FGCU coach Joe Dooley earned his 100th career win as the Eagles (21-7, 11-1 Atlantic Sun) stayed one game ahead of North Florida in the conference standings. Florida Gulf Coast's 86 points were a season high with Julian DeBose adding 13 points and Jamail Jones 11. USC Upstate (20-9, 7-5) trailed by 10 at the break, but FGCU opened the second half with a 14-3 burst to lead 58-37 with 15:36 to go. The Spartans got no closer than 14 points when ShunQuez Stephens capped the scoring. Ty Greene led Upstate with 31 points, his second 30-point game of the season. Fred Miller added 12.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
